file_summary: This Java class, `WebConfiguration`, configures internationalization (i18n) support for the Spring PetClinic application. It defines how the application determines and changes the user's language preference. Specifically, it configures a `SessionLocaleResolver` to store the user's chosen locale in their session, defaulting to English. It also sets up a `LocaleChangeInterceptor` which allows users to change the language by adding a `?lang=` parameter to the URL (e.g., `?lang=de` for German). This interceptor is then registered with the Spring MVC interceptor registry, ensuring it processes every incoming request to check for language changes. This setup provides a robust mechanism for multi-language support within the web application.
